intro: Nototriche ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf nototriche, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are ovate in shape and often have a distinctive white or pale underside. Nototriche ovalifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
